snippet: The Japanese automaker, the largest in the world by sales, raised its full-year profit forecast even as it sold fewer vehicles.
abstract: Toyota Motor lifts annual profit forecast after almost doubling net income in quarter ending in June to 562.1 billion yen ($5.64 billion) from year earlier, thanks to favorable exchange rates.
lead_paragraph: The Japanese automaker, the largest in the world by sales, raised its full-year profit forecast even as it sold fewer vehicles.

headline.main: Weakening Yen Helps Toyota Double Its Quarterly Profit
headline.print_headline: Weakening Yen Helps Toyota Double Its Quarterly Profit
